author: Corren

review: Should have read the feature description better.  This does NOT have a Vudu app.  I have my movies on a Synology 5-bay server with extra memory, and currently use Plex to watch movies from that.  I was not able to find a way for this stick to allow me to browse through my movies.  It could find them if I did a title search, but that was it.  For me this was a waste of money.  I originally bought this for someone else, but after it arrived I found out they did not need it. I was curious how well it worked.  The third problem was that I  could not watch my bluray movies in 1080p at anything faster than half speed.  I connected to my AC router on the 5 ghz band and it could not play in normal speed due to not being able to handle the volume of data being pushed through for the movie.  My movies are usually around 12 to 16 GB per bluray.  I could go lower than 1080p and have it play, but that was it.  A Roku stick that I used to have was able to play them using wifi.
author: Craig N. Raper "fafow"

review: I like that it is easier to use than another type of streaming product that uses a phone app to change the movies around. With this one you use the remote or you can use an app AND it has more than just Netflix. There are Prime movies, games, and music. I love it so much more than the other type I had!
